oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tools for managing manure nutrients
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shepherd, Mark
Philipps, Lois
Webb, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Education, extension and communication
Knowledge management
Farm nutrient management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Manures are a valuable source of nutrients (and organic matter), and can be seen as a method of transferring nutrients around the farm (for homeproduced manures) or as a method of importing fertility (imported manures or composts). Good manure management offers a ‘win-win’ opportunity: benefits to soil fertility and benefits to the environment (less pollution). This paper describes two tools for manure nutrient planning: the use of look-up tables to assess nutrient content, and the development of a Decision Support Tool for describing nutrient transformations during manure management.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Shepherd, Mark; Philipps, Lois and Webb, John (2002) Tools for managing manure nutrients. In: Powell, Jane and et al., (Eds.) Proceedings of the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference, Organic Centre Wales, Institute of Rural Studies, University of Wales Aberystwyth, pp. 165-168.
